data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3281843,"name":"Lucas Fontes Francisco","username":"temaosmetais","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/temaosmetais/{size}/209698_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-12T13:16:41.269Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eOur team’s setting up a MK2 swerve, we’re using 0 to Autonomous’ code (\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/SeanSun6814/FRC0ToAutonomous/tree/master/%236%20Swerve%20Drive%20Auto\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eFRC0ToAutonomous/#6 Swerve Drive Auto at master · SeanSun6814/FRC0ToAutonomous · GitHub\u003c/a\u003e). Our robot is slow though, we found motor speed limiters in the code’s \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePID\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Proportional Integral Derivative\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e however we don’t really get the hang of it. Can someone enlighten us?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-01-12T13:16:41.269Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":79,"readers_count":78,"score":65.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":449643,"topic_slug":"mk2-swerve-pid-question","display_username":"Lucas Fontes Francisco","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/SeanSun6814/FRC0ToAutonomous/tree/master/%236%20Swerve%20Drive%20Auto","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC0ToAutonomous/#6 Swerve Drive Auto at master · SeanSun6814/FRC0ToAutonomous · GitHub","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62991,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"temaosmetais"},"post_url":"/t/mk2-swerve-pid-question/449643/1","custom_user_title":"temaosmetais","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3281890,"name":"Ari Steinfeld","username":"1712ControlSystemGuy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/1712controlsystemguy/{size}/212282_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-12T14:15:14.329Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eBasically you’ve got velocity calculated in the x and the y, these are your trajectories. By doing the math with those you can figure out where you want your robot to be, and compare it with where it actually is using odometry. The path file gets converted into a list of velocities and positions for times, and your code then tries as hard as it can to make the robot match that. The P value controls the proportion that the speed is multiplied by based on how far off it is from where it should be (the error). So with a higher proportion, it will snap to positions better but also can over-correct and overshoot. Your d value attempts to handle any static friction that may need to be overcome, so for your case it is most likely useless. Your I value is the integral, so it adds a constant value to the output based off of how far you are. It may be useful to have a small I value due to the friction from the carpet and overcoming the normal force, but with newer motors, they really aren’t necessary. The acceleration constants should be set to slightly below your robot’s max acceleration, which I recommend calculating. Overall, a limit in the speed is usually an issue in the path itself, because that is a list of velocities. In the path drawer, make sure you have the max speed set to something near your robot’s max speed. If I got anything wrong please let me know.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-01-12T14:15:14.329Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":59,"readers_count":58,"score":11.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":449643,"topic_slug":"mk2-swerve-pid-question","display_username":"Ari
